result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • William M Buksyk was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $500.00 applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Remanded into custody immediately.  IMPOSED as a condition of probation.  Good time is authorized as is a mandatory sentence.  With huber privileges if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  GPS is not authorized for the first 3 months of sentence.  Transfer is authorized to Waupaca County, Wisconsin.

OWI(5TH OR 6TH)
CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by Physician.   Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.   No driving until valid.
